text: `${pick} lays down. `
`within a minute the lights are off and ${pick} feels the stiffness of the floor`
`it's hard to call it a mattress since it's only 3 inches thick, around 30 inches wide, and it barely has any padding.`
`looking at it, ${pick} wonders how long this thing has been used for.`
`at least five years...`
`but that doesn't matter because ${pick} knows that there is no turning back`
`just needs to get used to it`
`${pick} doesn't move a single inch because it will just make it even more uncomfortable`
`stays fixed with arms aligned next to the body`
`lights have been off for an hour now, but the moonlight seeps in through the window.`
`closes eyse and wonders, 'why am i here?'`
`now it's pitch black, and memories flood into the pitch black vision.`
`it's ${pick}'s first day in the military. ${pick} just spent the first night in the training facility before getting drafted into a differnt base`
`luckily? ${pick} is placed in a room with 12 other kids. the rooms are usually filled with 20 kids.`
`it's the first time since 6th grade that ${pick}'s been surrounded by the other kids`
`the day has begun. everyone finally introduced themselves to one another.`
`this is probably the first time ${pick} realized that ${pick} is not American.`
`the fact that ${pick} is here, serving in the ${lang} military states that ${pick} is ${lang}.`
`${pick} thinks, 'how much more time do i have to spend in the u.s. to become one of them?' `
`there is a saying that 'within ten years, even the mountains and rivers change their forms.' `
`yet, time spent in the states didn't do much for ${pick}`
`the more ${pick} talked to the peers in the millitary, the more ${pick} begins to realize that ${pick} has nothing in common with them`
`${pick} feels as if ${pick} is back to the 7th grade all over again.`
`after figuring out that ${pick}'s been abroad, they began to ask questions.`
`'why are you here?' `
`'couldn't you have avoided coming here?'`
`perhaps. but then ${pick} will really have no place to go `
`as days passed, they began to treat ${pick} as a foreigner.`
`it was both true and false.`
`when we had what's known as 'free' time, 12 of us sat on the pedestal and talked. `
`the pedestal is also where we unfold the thin mattresses and sleep.`
`But interestingly, whenever they were laughing, ${pick} couldn't understand what was so funny. `
`despite ${pick} fluent in ${lang}, ${pick} couldn't understand the jokes. `
`the worst part was that ${pick} couldn't memorize everyone's name even after 2 weeks has been passed.`
